description.narrative: By end 2021, the government and child protection partners are committed to and capable of legislating, planning and budgeting as regards interventions designed to: prevent or respond to child marriage and FGM/C support a justice system that is responsive to the specific needs of children and birth registration,which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: By the end of 2021, women, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, make greater use of quality public protection services (civil registration service, juvenile justice and social assistance).

sector.narrative: Alternative care reform and service provision
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Public finance management for child protection
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

Chad United Nations Development Assistance Framework

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, the government and child protection partners are committed to and capable of legislating, planning and budgeting as regards interventions designed to: prevent or respond to child marriage and FGM/C; support a justice system that is responsive to the specific needs of children; and birth registration

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF continued to support the government to set up a strong Child Protection Coordination Committee that brings together key stakeholders from the government and civil society organizations at all levels, following adoption of a Ministerial Decree establishing such a mechanism. UNICEF also continued to provide technical support for the establishment of an interoperability mechanism between the civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) system and health services, to contribute to improving birth registration results. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/02/2020

title.narrative: Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation
Country implementing a costed national action plan or strategy to end child marriage
Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
